TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Domain extends System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ActiveDirectoryPartition

Docs.summary: The class represents an Active Directory domain.
Gets the domains that are children of this domain.
Docs.value: An object that contains the child domains.
Docs.exception: The object has been disposed.

MemberSignature.Value: public void CreateLocalSideOfTrustRelationship (string targetDomainName, System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.TrustDirection direction, string trustPassword);

.method public hidebysig instance void CreateLocalSideOfTrustRelationship(string targetDomainName, valuetype System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.TrustDirection direction, string trustPassword) cil managed

Docs.param: The DNS name of the domain that the trust is created with.
One of the members that determines the direction of the trust, relative to this domain.
The password for the trust.
Docs.summary: Creates the local side of a trust relationship with the specified domain.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method creates one side of a trust relationship. The trust is not established until both sides of the trust have been created.
The `trustPassword` parameter associates a password with the created trust. When the other side of the trust is created, the same password is provided and the two local trusts are then bound to each other.
To programmatically create both sides of a trust relationship in a single method call, use the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.Domain.CreateTrustRelationship%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.

Docs.exception: The trust relationship already exists.
A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.
The target server is either busy or unavailable.
or is empty.
or is .
is not a valid value.
The object has been disposed.
The specified account does not have permission to perform this operation.

Docs.param: A object that represents the domain that the trust is being created with.
One of the members that determines the direction of the trust, relative to this domain.
Docs.summary: Creates both sides of a trust relationship with the specified domain.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method creates both sides of a trust relationship with a single method call. The <xref:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.Domain.CreateLocalSideOfTrustRelationship%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method is used to create only one side of a trust.

Docs.exception: The trust relationship already exists.
A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.
The target server is either busy or unavailable.
is .
is not a valid value.
The object has been disposed.
The specified account does not have permission to perform this operation.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void DeleteLocalSideOfTrustRelationship(string targetDomainName) cil managed

Docs.param: The DNS name of the domain that the trust exists with.
Docs.summary: Deletes the local side of a trust relationship.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When one side of a trust relationship is deleted, the trust longer exists.
To delete both sides of a trust relationship with one method call, use the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.Domain.DeleteTrustRelationship%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.

Docs.exception: There is no trust relationship with the that is specified by the parameter.
A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.
The target server is either busy or unavailable.
is an empty string.
is .
The object has been disposed.
The specified account does not have permission to perform this operation.

Docs.summary: Deletes both sides of a trust relationship.

remarks.format: ## Remarks To delete only one side of a trust relationship, use the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.Domain.DeleteLocalSideOfTrustRelationship%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DomainControllerCollection FindAllDiscoverableDomainControllers() cil managed

Docs.summary: Finds all of the discoverable domain controllers in this domain.
Docs.returns: A that contains the domain controller objects that were found by this method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You can find discoverable domain controllers by querying DNS SRV records. Only those domain controllers that register the generic, non-site-specific, domain controller SRV record will be returned by this method.

Docs.exception: The target server is either busy or unavailable.
The object has been disposed.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DomainControllerCollection FindAllDiscoverableDomainControllers(string siteName) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the site to search for the domain controllers.
Docs.summary: Finds all of the discoverable domain controllers in this domain that are also in the specified site.
Docs.returns: A that contains the domain controller objects that were found by this method.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can find discoverable domain controllers by querying DNS SRV records. If a domain controller does not register an SRV record for the specified site, it will not be returned by this method, even if the domain controller is physically located within that site.
All domain controllers that register an SRV record for the specified site will be returned by this method, even if they are not physically located within that site.

Docs.exception: The target server is either busy or unavailable.
is an empty string.
is .
The object has been disposed.

Docs.summary: Finds any domain controller in this domain.
Docs.returns: A that represents the domain controller that is found by this method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method finds any domain controller in the domain. There is no guarantee that the same domain controller will be found by another call to this method.

A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.Domain GetComputerDomain() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the object that represents the domain to which the local computer is joined.
Docs.returns: A object that represents the domain to which the local machine is joined.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The return value of the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.Domain.GetComputerDomain%2A> method is a <xref:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.Domain> object representing the domain to which the computer running the application is joined. This return value is independent of the domain credentials under which the application is run. This method will retrieve the computer's domain regardless of the trusted account domain credentials it is run under. To retrieve the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.Domain> object that represents the domain corresponding to the user credentials in effect for the security context under which the application is running, use the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.Domain.GetCurrentDomain%2A> method instead.

Docs.exception: A connection to the domain could not be made.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.Domain GetCurrentDomain() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the object for the current user credentials in effect for the security context under which the application is running.
Docs.returns: A object that represents the domain for the specified user credentials in effect for the security context under which the application is running.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.Domain.GetCurrentDomain%2A> method is determined by the domain credentials under which the application is running. To retrieve the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.Domain> object representing the domain to which the computer running the application is joined, regardless of the credentials associated with that application, use the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.Domain.GetComputerDomain%2A> method instead.
## See Also <xref:System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.Domain.GetComputerDomain%2A>

Docs.exception: A connection to the current context could not be made.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void RaiseDomainFunctionality(valuetype System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DomainMode domainMode) cil managed

Docs.param: An enumeration value that specifies the new operation level for the domain.
Docs.summary: Raises the mode of operation for the domain.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The value can be raised but not lowered. This means that raising the functionality level of the domain is not reversible and the decision to do this should be made carefully. For more information about domain operational modes, see [Domain and forest functionality](http://www.microsoft.com/resources/documentation/WindowsServ/2003/standard/proddocs/en-us/sag_levels.asp). The following table defines the valid values for `domainMode` based on the current operating mode of the domain. |Current mode|Mode can be raised to| |------------------|---------------------------| ||



| ||| ||| ||None|

Docs.exception: A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.
The target server is either busy or unavailable.
Based on the current operating mode of the domain, the value specified for is not valid.
is not a valid enumeration value.
The object has been disposed.
The specified account does not have permission to perform this operation.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void RaiseDomainFunctionalityLevel(int32 domainMode) cil managed

Docs.param: A value representing the new level.
Docs.summary: Raises the functionality level for the domain.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void RepairTrustRelationship(class System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.Domain targetDomain) cil managed

Docs.param: An object that represents the domain with which the trust exists.
Docs.summary: Repairs a trust relationship.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method repairs the trust by resetting the secure channel for the trust. If the operation fails to reset the secure channel, then it will also reset the trust password.

Docs.exception: There is no trust relationship with the that is specified by .
A call to the underlying directory service resulted in an error.
The target or source server is either busy or unavailable.
